intro: Tanacetum albanicum, commonly known as the Albanian tansy, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers that are arranged in flat-topped clusters. Tanacetum albanicum is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
